characters.name: King Juan II of Castile
characters.title: King of Castile and León
characters.current_task: Beginning personal rule; planning pilgrimage to Rome
characters.speech_style: Earnest and direct when speaking privately; can adopt a naive persona strategically
characters.core_characteristics: Young king of Castile, age 25 in 1430. Has ruled nominally since infancy but only recently begun personal rule. Surprisingly strategic for his youth. Relies heavily on Álvaro de Luna but desires true independence.

characters.name: Álvaro de Luna
characters.title: Constable of Castile
characters.current_task: Preparing the kingdom for Juan's departure; constrained by regency council agreement
characters.speech_style: Carefully controlled intensity. Dark watchful eyes. Shifts between calculated calm and passionate urgency.
characters.core_characteristics: Juan II's closest confidant and de facto ruler of Castile. Of minor nobility, resented by great nobles as a 'low-born upstart.' Extraordinarily capable administrator and politician. Genuinely loyal to the king but wields enormous power.

appearance.distinguishing_features: dark, watchful eyes

characters.name: Fernán Alonso de Robles
characters.title: Captain of the Royal Guard
characters.current_task: Training the king in combat; equipping the royal guard
characters.speech_style: Direct and soldierly. Assesses situations frankly. Professional but warm.
characters.core_characteristics: Captain of the royal guard of ~30 men. Practical soldier who assesses the king honestly. Trains Juan II in combat. Given 150,000 maravedís to equip the guard.

characters.name: Fray Hernando de Talavera
characters.title: Royal Confessor
characters.current_task: Appointed as Juan II's new confessor; preparing for the pilgrimage
characters.speech_style: Humble and sincere
characters.core_characteristics: Young Franciscan monk chosen by Juan II as his confessor. Selected for his youth (can keep up on travels), humility, and pure Christian faith.

characters.name: Pedro Fernández de Velasco
characters.title: Corregidor of Seville
characters.current_task: Serving as corregidor in Seville; reporting on noble feuds and Aragonese infiltration
characters.speech_style: Respectful and formal in correspondence, with undertones of concern
characters.core_characteristics: Royal magistrate (corregidor) in Seville. Reports on Guzmán-Ponce de León feuds and suspicious Aragonese gold flowing to local nobles.

characters.name: Íñigo López de Mendoza
characters.title: Adelantado of the Frontier
characters.current_task: Serving as Adelantado of the frontier; reporting on Moorish raids near Alcalá la Real
characters.speech_style: Brief and direct, a soldier's report style
characters.core_characteristics: Military governor of the Granada frontier. Reports on raids and assesses offensive capability. Future Marquis of Santillana and renowned poet. Considered a potential royal supporter.

characters.name: Lope de Barrientos
characters.title: Bishop
characters.current_task: Summoned to join Juan II's advisory cabinet
characters.core_characteristics: Bishop and scholar at Salamanca University. Summoned to join Juan II's advisory cabinet. Trusted as a potential loyalist.

characters.name: Pedro Manrique
characters.current_task: Summoned to join Juan II's advisory cabinet
characters.core_characteristics: Noble mentioned as a potential member of Juan II's advisory cabinet. From the Manrique family.

characters.name: Archbishop Cerezuela of Toledo
characters.title: Archbishop of Toledo
characters.current_task: Mentioned as potential council member
characters.core_characteristics: Archbishop of Toledo. Mentioned as a suitable member for the planned noble council.

characters.name: Infante Juan de Aragón, King of Navarra
characters.title: Infante of Aragón, King of Navarra
characters.current_task: Seeking to control Castilian governance through a noble council
characters.speech_style: Honeyed and diplomatic, wraps demands in fraternal concern, careful word choice
characters.core_characteristics: Elder of the Infantes de Aragón. Politically astute, uses charm and family ties to disguise his ambition. Holds vast estates in Castile. Cousin of Juan II.

appearance.distinguishing_features: narrow, watchful eyes; practiced smile

characters.name: Infante Enrique de Aragón
characters.title: Infante of Aragón, Master of Santiago
characters.current_task: Supporting his brother's bid to control Castilian governance
characters.speech_style: More direct and blunt than his brother Juan, less diplomatic, speaks with an edge
characters.core_characteristics: Younger Infante de Aragón. More impulsive and militaristic than his brother. Previously controlled Juan II's household during the regency. Master of the Order of Santiago.

appearance.distinguishing_features: military bearing; broad grin

characters.name: Archbishop Juan Martínez de Contreras
characters.title: Archbishop of Toledo
characters.current_task: Advocating for a crusade against Granada and proper Church tithes
characters.speech_style: Elegant clerical register with Latin phrases, combines spiritual authority with political messaging
characters.core_characteristics: Archbishop of Toledo (1423-1434). Advocates for crusade against Granada and increased Church authority. Concerned about converso prominence in Toledo.

characters.name: Sultan Muhammad IX of Granada
characters.title: Sultan of the Nasrid Kingdom of Granada
characters.core_characteristics: Sultan of the Nasrid Kingdom. Pays tribute (parias) to Castile for peace. Mentioned in reports but does not appear directly.

characters.name: Juan de Daza
characters.title: Treasury Official
characters.current_task: Serving in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet; tracking treasury flows and urban intelligence
characters.speech_style: Practical and measured; speaks from experience with money and commerce
characters.core_characteristics: Treasury official and commoner in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet. Meticulous record-keeper. The Infantes later tried to remove him for being loyal to Álvaro, but Juan II retained him with a compromise: shared reports to the regency council.

characters.name: Diego Gómez de Sandoval, Count of Castro
characters.title: Count of Castro
characters.current_task: Serving in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet; observing court factions
characters.speech_style: Refined and diplomatic; careful word choice reflecting converso awareness of social dynamics
characters.core_characteristics: Converso noble in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet. Tasked with observing court factions. His family faces occasional discrimination, making him keenly aware of political undercurrents. Age ~32 in 1430.

characters.name: Rodrigo Manrique
characters.title: Frontier Soldier
characters.current_task: Serving in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet; providing military intelligence on the frontier
characters.speech_style: Short, blunt, soldierly. Cuts through formality with harsh frontier honesty. Barks laughs at courtly pretension.
characters.core_characteristics: Frontier veteran of 20+ years in Juan II's secret advisory cabinet. Provides military intelligence. Gave a brutally honest assessment of the Granada frontier: most frontier lords profit from perpetual low-intensity conflict. Any real conquest would take 8-15 years and require unified command.

characters.name: García Fernández
characters.title: City Representative
characters.current_task: Representing city interests at the Valladolid court
characters.speech_style: Careful and deferential; a merchant choosing words before authority
characters.core_characteristics: City representative (possibly from Seville) who attended the regency installation. Raised practical concerns about daily governance during the king's absence. Directed to petition Álvaro for routine matters.

characters.name: Juan de Silva
characters.current_task: Supporting Álvaro de Luna's network; concerned about Álvaro's safety under the regency
characters.speech_style: Quiet and measured; speaks carefully to avoid being overheard
characters.core_characteristics: Mid-ranking noble in Álvaro de Luna's network. Attended the regency installation and expressed concern about Álvaro's safety — warning that the Infantes might charge Álvaro with a crime during Juan's absence.

characters.name: Sergeant García
characters.title: Sergeant of the Royal Guard
characters.current_task: Accompanying Juan II on pilgrimage after serving as one of two guards in the deception operation
characters.speech_style: Blunt and experienced; speaks with the weight of twenty years of frontier service
characters.core_characteristics: Grizzled veteran in his forties with scars on his weathered face. One of the two guards Juan II selected for his secret return to Valladolid. Shared honest war stories during the two-night wait in the shepherd's hut. First kill at seventeen. Has served the crown faithfully for decades.

appearance.distinguishing_features: scars on weathered face

characters.name: Corporal Rodrigo
characters.title: Corporal of the Royal Guard
characters.current_task: Accompanying Juan II on pilgrimage after serving as one of two guards in the deception operation
characters.speech_style: Practical and direct
characters.core_characteristics: Eight-year veteran of the royal guard. One of the two guards selected for Juan II's secret return to Valladolid. Shared that the waiting before battle is worse than the battle itself.

characters.name: Marquis de Santillana
characters.title: Marquis de Santillana
characters.current_task: Serving on the regency council during Juan II's pilgrimage
characters.speech_style: Measured and careful; weighs every word for political implications
characters.core_characteristics: Elder Mendoza family representative on the regency council. The Mendoza family is one of Castile's great noble houses, rivals to the Velascos. Initially a four-member council (with Infante Juan), now serves on the three-member unanimous-consent council alongside Infante Enrique and the Archbishop of Toledo.

characters.name: Alfonso V of Aragon
characters.title: King of Aragon
characters.current_task: Pursuing Italian ambitions (seeking Naples); received diplomatic letter about his brothers' conduct in Castile
characters.core_characteristics: King of Aragon, ~34 in 1430, known as 'the Magnanimous.' Married to María of Castile (Juan II's sister) but has no heir. Focused on Italian ambitions — seeking Naples. His younger brothers (the Infantes Juan and Enrique) meddle in Castilian politics while Alfonso pursues Mediterranean power. A diplomatic letter was sent to him after Infante Juan was removed from the regency council.

characters.name: Sir Thomas Beaumont
characters.title: Knight
characters.current_task: Serving as military escort and informal advisor on Juan II's Rome journey; given seat on travel council
characters.speech_style: Practical English directness with chivalric courtesy
characters.core_characteristics: English knight encountered at Santiago de Compostela, hired for honor and provisions rather than pay. Experienced with French roads from military service. Helped select horses and check equipment. Accompanied by his squire Peter. Proved valuable for his knowledge of European travel routes and combat experience.

characters.name: Cardinal Giordano Orsini
characters.title: Cardinal
characters.current_task: Serving as Pope Martin V's closest advisor; facilitated Juan II's papal audience and crusade bull
characters.speech_style: Fluent Castilian; probing and careful, with the measured tone of a man who has seen everything
characters.core_characteristics: Pope Martin V's closest advisor, ~65 in 1430. Speaks fluent Castilian. Initially cautious about Juan II's mix of spiritual seeking and political calculation, but was profoundly moved by the act of renunciation before the Pope. Helped draft the crusade bull and offered to write to Spanish bishops about what he witnessed. Warned Juan about papal succession politics.

characters.name: Pope Martin V
characters.title: Pope
characters.current_task: Granted crusade bull 'Inter Cetera Divinae Providentiae' to Juan II; nearing end of pontificate
characters.speech_style: Formal papal register that breaks into genuine warmth when moved; speaks with authority of the Vicar of Christ
characters.core_characteristics: Pope since 1417 (ended the Western Schism). Age 72 in 1430, frail but sharp-eyed. Deeply moved by Juan II's act of complete renunciation — knelt beside the young king and personally commissioned the crusade. Granted sweeping crusade bull with sole command, taxation authority, Military Order reform, 20,000 florins, sacred relics, and diplomatic pressure on Aragon. Warned Juan to use these powers wisely.

appearance.distinguishing_features: sharp, intelligent eyes despite age; trembling hands

characters.name: Cosimo de' Medici
characters.title: De facto ruler of Florence
characters.current_task: Hosting Juan II's visit and supporting the crusade speech; commissioned the all-white banner
characters.speech_style: Refined, witty, speaks with the confidence of immense wealth and political acumen
characters.core_characteristics: De facto ruler of Florence through the Medici banking fortune. Age ~41 in 1430. First encountered Juan on the road during the France journey, offering advice about approaching the Pope. Hosted Juan at the Palazzo Medici and arranged the grand public speech in the Piazza della Signoria. Impressed by Juan's boldness and spiritual conviction.

characters.name: Don Luis de Guzmán
characters.title: Master of the Order of Santiago
characters.current_task: Allied with the Infantes' revolt; Master of Santiago, the wealthiest military order
characters.core_characteristics: Master of the Order of Santiago, the largest and wealthiest military order in Castile. Allied with the Infantes de Aragón during their failed revolt. One of the few major figures to support the rebellion openly.

characters.name: Queen María of Aragon
characters.title: Queen of Aragon
characters.current_task: Managing the Aragonese court in Alfonso V's absence; supporting her brother Juan II's crusade from Barcelona
characters.speech_style: Warm and sisterly with Juan, but measured when discussing politics; carries the weight of years alone
characters.core_characteristics: Juan II's older sister, married to Alfonso V of Aragon since 1415. Age ~34 in 1430. Has no children. Left Castile at 19, only seen Juan twice since. Alfonso is focused on Italian ambitions (Naples), leaving her isolated in Barcelona. Manages court and receives ambassadors but real power rests with the Consell Reial. Provides Juan critical intelligence about the Infantes' revolt. Warns about the political complications of his decisions. Arranges social events that introduce Juan to Barcelona's elite.

characters.name: Isabel Ruiz
characters.current_task: Daughter of converso merchant Rodrigo Ruiz; met Juan II at María's dinner and challenged him about protecting Muslims
characters.speech_style: Direct and questioning, sometimes bold enough to embarrass her parents; speaks from genuine conviction rather than court training
characters.core_characteristics: 17-year-old daughter of converso cloth merchant Rodrigo Ruiz. Auburn hair, green eyes, freckled. Her grandfather was born Jewish and converted. Family wealthy from trade but always watched and judged. She challenged Juan directly about his promise to protect Muslims who surrender. Juan fell deeply in love with her at first sight, but a relationship proved impossible — as a converso, any affair would mark her as a harlot. Juan's crisis of certainty about his feelings for her led to important self-reflection.

characters.name: Marco Tornesi
characters.title: Crusader
characters.current_task: First Italian crusader; serving as training sergeant for new recruits; accepted into the crusade in the dawn oath ceremony
characters.speech_style: Lean, practical soldier's speech; carries shame from mercenary past
characters.core_characteristics: Former mercenary (~30 years old), lean and weather-beaten. First of four Italians to ride from Florence to Barcelona after Juan's speech. Former soldier for Milan and Genoa, now seeking redemption through the crusade. Proved excellent as training sergeant. Only one of the four with genuine combat experience. Some Castilian. Accepted in the dawn oath ceremony before the banner and relics.

appearance.distinguishing_features: weather-beaten face

characters.name: Abu Abdullah al-Zaghal
characters.title: Ambassador of Granada
characters.current_task: Returned from failed diplomatic mission to Seville; reported Juan II's rejection of peace terms and the scale of the crusade preparations
characters.speech_style: Fluent Castilian; formal but direct, capable of carrying both threat and respect in the same sentence
characters.core_characteristics: Skilled Granadan diplomat, ~50 years old, gray beard. Led 12-person embassy to Seville with gifts worth ~20,000 dinars. Offered generous peace terms (doubled tribute, captive release, trade privileges, limited missionaries). When refused, warned Juan of Granada's unprecedented military support. Noted Juan's courtesy in walking from his throne to shake a Muslim's hand — called it 'unexpected and remembered.'

appearance.distinguishing_features: intelligent dark eyes, carefully groomed gray beard

characters.name: Princess Isabel of Portugal
characters.title: Princess of Portugal
characters.current_task: Betrothed to Juan II; arrived in Seville from Portugal; building partnership with Juan; wedding planned for late January/early February 1431
characters.speech_style: Careful and measured, with growing confidence; speaks learned Castilian; reveals intelligence in questions rather than statements
characters.core_characteristics: 15-year-old Portuguese princess, Juan II's betrothed. Dark hair, brown eyes, pale with freckles. Father allowed her to read in his library (history, philosophy, theology) though her confessor disapproved. Initially terrified by the reality of what she was marrying into (decade-long crusade, near civil war), but transformed when Juan was completely honest and treated her as a partner. Showed political acumen in analyzing Alfonso's letter. Dreams of being useful and intellectually engaged, not merely decorative.

characters.name: Cardinal Domenico Capranica
characters.title: Cardinal and Papal Legate to the Crusade
characters.current_task: Serving as papal legate to Juan II's crusade; initial cooperation on budget management but long-term serious conflict predicted
characters.speech_style: Formal, precise, insistent on proper procedure; thin voice that carries surprisingly well
characters.core_characteristics: 62-year-old Italian cardinal appointed as papal legate to the crusade. Bureaucratic obstructionist with decent resources but maximum red tape — every decision requires documentation in triplicate. Initial meeting with Juan went well (honeymoon period), but long-term relationship will be seriously conflicted. His administrator Father Tommaso works excellently with Álvaro de Luna on budget management.

characters.name: Father Tommaso Parentucelli
characters.title: Papal Administrator to the Legate
characters.current_task: Serving as Cardinal Capranica's administrator; developed outstanding working relationship with Álvaro on crusade budget management; prepared formal budget documents and assessment team letters of authority
characters.speech_style: Practical and matter-of-fact; speaks up when he has useful information; ever-present writing materials
characters.core_characteristics: Italian priest serving as Cardinal Capranica's administrator, approximately 40 years old. Practical-minded and focused on results rather than procedure, contrasting with his Cardinal's obsessive formality. His excellent working relationship with Álvaro de Luna (roll: 77) created the comprehensive 47-page campaign budget and provides a functional channel between crown and legate even when leaders clash. Always has writing materials at hand.

appearance.distinguishing_features: ink-stained hands

characters.name: Doña Beatriz
characters.title: Lady-in-Waiting to Queen Isabel
characters.current_task: Serving as senior lady-in-waiting to Queen Isabel; under crown protection after Cardinal Capranica's attempt to dismiss the Portuguese attendants
characters.speech_style: Quiet and dignified; speaks with careful courtesy; emotional when her loyalty and faith are questioned
characters.core_characteristics: Approximately 40 years old, from an old Portuguese noble house. Senior among Isabel's three Portuguese ladies-in-waiting who sailed with her from Portugal. Deeply devout Catholic who follows the Roman breviary with Portuguese traditional devotions (Our Lady of the Conception, feast of Saint Vincent). Her composure and dignity helped defuse the Cardinal's challenge to the Portuguese attendants' presence at court.

characters.name: Don Fadrique
characters.title: Head of the Toledo Family
characters.current_task: Attending court in Toledo for the royal wedding; supported Isabel publicly at the Archbishop's dinner
characters.speech_style: Direct and supportive; speaks up at key moments
characters.core_characteristics: Head of the powerful Toledo family. Publicly supported Isabel at the Archbishop's dinner, declaring 'Castile is blessed in its Queen!' Appears to be aligned with the crown's interests.

characters.name: Don Pedro González de Mendoza
characters.title: Heir of House Mendoza
characters.current_task: Taking crusader oath at royal wedding; committed to serving in crusade with chance to rise through ranks based on merit; House Mendoza pledging 1,800 levies
characters.speech_style: Direct and thoughtful; weighs words carefully; honest about both ambitions and limitations
characters.core_characteristics: Son and heir of Don Íñigo López de Mendoza the Elder. Age 30, dark-haired with strong family resemblance. Attended Dominican college at Salamanca for two years. Has commanded household guard in frontier skirmishes (up to 300 men) but no major campaign experience. Grandfather fell at Antequera. Volunteered to take crusader oath with genuine fervor after seeing relics. Juan promised him opportunity to rise to greater command based on ability.

appearance.distinguishing_features: strong family resemblance to father

characters.name: Don Enrique Enríquez
characters.title: Admiral of Castile
characters.current_task: Committed to full cooperation with crusade assessment teams; offered naval expertise and ships for crusade logistics; future role in Castilian fleet expansion
characters.speech_style: Starts nervous and formal but becomes animated and confident when discussing naval matters; tends to ramble when anxious
characters.core_characteristics: Admiral of Castile, approximately 40 years old. Competent administrator rather than warrior, with soft hands and nervous bearing around royalty. Controls unusual maritime-based wealth (ports, fishing rights, salt works, shipping). Provided detailed strategic analysis of Castile's naval weakness (~30 ships vs Aragon's 60-80 war galleys) and advocated for long-term fleet development. Offered 4 carracks, 6 caravels, and ability to contract 8-12 more ships. Confirmed Portuguese dowry galleys individually superior to Granada's fleet.

appearance.distinguishing_features: golden anchor chain of office; soft administrator's hands

characters.name: Don Pedro González de Padilla
characters.title: Master of the Order of Calatrava
characters.current_task: Appointed commander of eastern army (23,000 troops) in Juan's absence; working with Tommaso on logistics; preparing to lead the central frontier assault on Granada
characters.speech_style: Plain-speaking and direct; speaks with professional military precision; asks probing strategic questions
characters.core_characteristics: Master of the Order of Calatrava, approximately 45 years old. Lean, fit professional soldier who knows the central frontier (Ciudad Real, Calatrava la Nueva, mountain passes into Granada) intimately. Fought Moors in approximately 24 engagements over decades. Came at Guzmán's urging and pledged Calatrava's 1,500 knights. Appointed eastern army commander — honest that he's never led 23,000 men but willing to learn. Provided expert analysis of terrain challenges (water supply, mountain passes, Sultan's likely strategy). Impressed by unprecedented logistical preparation.

appearance.distinguishing_features: black Calatrava robes with red cross

characters.name: Master Gonzalo de Burgos
characters.title: Royal Armorer
characters.current_task: Creating Juan's distinctive all-white Milan plate armor with white plume, banner poles, and two helmets; delivered completed armor three days before wedding
characters.speech_style: Professional and detailed when discussing craft; becomes animated and enthusiastic about challenging commissions
characters.core_characteristics: Master armorer in his fifties with burn-scarred forearms from decades at the forge. Commissioned to create Juan's distinctive white crusader armor — full Milan plate with white plume, white tabard, banner pole sockets, and two helmets (show helm and combat helm). Pragmatic about battlefield dangers of visibility but embraced the vision. Completed in 17 days working day and night with three apprentices. The commission will make him the most sought-after armorer in Castile.

appearance.distinguishing_features: burn-scarred forearms

characters.name: Don Rodrigo de Villalobos
characters.title: Chief Chamberlain of the Royal Household
characters.current_task: Managing royal household logistics for wedding day and ongoing court operations; coordinating procession routes, armoring schedules, and noble arrivals
characters.speech_style: Formal and professionally precise; occasionally overcome by genuine emotion when witnessing extraordinary events
characters.core_characteristics: Elderly chief chamberlain who supervised all wedding day preparations with military precision. Coordinated Juan's private armoring at the Alcázar, managed the processional route through Toledo, and organized the return. A man of protocol and order who was visibly moved beyond his usual formality by the spectacle of Juan in white armor.

appearance.distinguishing_features: bearing of a senior court official

characters.name: Master Pietro Calabrese
characters.title: Master Gunner
characters.current_task: Commanding 5 medium bombards with 30 gunners; preparing to march from Toledo to Jaen by March 5-10 for eastern army campaign; reassigned from western to eastern army
characters.speech_style: Heavily accented Castilian (Italian native); blunt and direct; speaks with professional authority about his craft; does not mince words about tactical reality
characters.core_characteristics: Italian master gunner from Milan, hired at considerable expense. Approximately 50 years old with burn scars on forearms from decades of work with powder. Missing several teeth, squinting eyes from years of bright flashes. Commands 5 medium bombards (50-pound stone balls, 300-400 yard range) with crews of 6 each plus 2 assistant master gunners. Demands: extra oxen (10 per gun), guaranteed infantry protection, weather-protected powder transport, good reconnaissance, and authority to refuse tactically unsound operations. Quote: 'Use us well, and we win you fortresses. Use us badly, and you lose everything.'

appearance.distinguishing_features: burn scars on forearms; missing teeth; squinting eyes from powder flashes

characters.name: Dona Catarina
characters.title: Portuguese Lady-in-Waiting to Queen Isabel
characters.current_task: Accompanying Queen Isabel on horseback journeys between Jaen and Seville; evolving from dutiful attendant to genuine companion; the only lady-in-waiting physically capable of riding with the army
characters.speech_style: Reserved and formal initially; gradually reveals dry, understated humor when relaxed; practical rather than courtly
characters.core_characteristics: Portuguese lady-in-waiting to Queen Isabel, age 23. Dark-haired, slender, more athletic build than the other ladies. Competent rider (grew up near the Portuguese coast). Volunteered out of obligation rather than enthusiasm to accompany Isabel on the hard ride to Seville when Dona Beatriz was physically unable and the younger ladies were inadequate riders. Over the journey, her relationship with Isabel evolved from servant to companion. Her dry humor emerged as she grew more comfortable with the informal military travel.

appearance.distinguishing_features: athletic build unusual among court ladies

characters.name: Don García Fernández de Baeza
characters.title: Cavalry Commander / Commander of the First Battle
characters.current_task: Commanding the First Battle (Vanguard, 5,000 troops); veteran of 20 frontier campaigns; preparing for battle against Sultan's relief force
characters.speech_style: Direct, aggressive, speaks from two decades of frontier experience. Cuts to tactical reality quickly.
characters.core_characteristics: Age 38. Veteran of 20 frontier campaigns. Lean build, scarred face. Named commander of the First Battle (Vanguard, 5,000 troops). Aggressive tactician who favors bold action.

appearance.distinguishing_features: scarred face from decades of frontier fighting

characters.name: Don Rodrigo de Narváez
characters.title: Cavalry Commander / Commander of the Third Battle
characters.current_task: Commanding the Third Battle (Rear Guard, 5,000 troops); preparing for battle against Sultan's relief force
characters.speech_style: Measured, careful, methodical. Considers before speaking.
characters.core_characteristics: Age 42. Minor nobility of the Antequera frontier. Cautious and methodical — steady counterpart to Garcia Fernandez's aggression. Commander of the Third Battle (Rear Guard, 5,000 troops).

appearance.distinguishing_features: weathered frontier veteran's bearing

characters.name: Don Pedro Manrique de Lara
characters.title: Cavalry Column Commander
characters.current_task: Commanding one of six cavalry screening columns; younger cousin of Rodrigo Manrique
characters.speech_style: Energetic, sometimes overeager. Respectful of seniors but wants to distinguish himself.
characters.core_characteristics: Age 29. Younger cousin of Rodrigo Manrique (western army commander). Eager to prove himself worthy of the Manrique name.

appearance.distinguishing_features: bears family resemblance to Rodrigo Manrique

characters.name: Don Álvar Pérez de Guzmán
characters.title: Cavalry Column Commander
characters.current_task: Commanding cavalry screening column; providing intelligence analysis with Arabic language skills and deep understanding of Moorish tactics
characters.speech_style: Thoughtful and analytical. Peppers conversation with Arabic terms. Nuanced understanding of the enemy.
characters.core_characteristics: Age 35. Seville frontier nobility. Speaks Arabic fluently, understands Moorish tactics and culture. Invaluable intelligence asset.

appearance.distinguishing_features: dark complexion from years on the southern frontier

characters.name: Don Juan de Luna
characters.title: Cavalry Column Commander / Deep Reconnaissance Specialist
characters.current_task: Commanding deep reconnaissance cavalry column; his scouts detected Sultan's forced march, providing critical 48-hour warning; no relation to Álvaro de Luna
characters.speech_style: Quiet, precise, economical with words. Reports facts without embellishment.
characters.core_characteristics: Age 33. Murcia frontier specialist. Deep reconnaissance expert — his scouts provided the critical warning about the Sultan's forced march. No relation to Álvaro de Luna.

appearance.distinguishing_features: quiet bearing of a man accustomed to operating behind enemy lines

characters.name: Don Sancho de Rojas
characters.title: Cavalry Column Commander / Reserve
characters.current_task: Commanding reserve cavalry column; Calatrava Order veteran
characters.speech_style: Formal, military, disciplined. Structured cadence of a Military Order veteran.
characters.core_characteristics: Age 40. Calatrava Order veteran. Commands reserve cavalry column. Disciplined and reliable.

appearance.distinguishing_features: bears the red cross of Calatrava

characters.name: Yusuf ibn Rashid
characters.title: Former Commander of Alcala la Real Fortress
characters.current_task: Converting to Christianity and swearing fealty to Castilian crown; offering 32 years of military experience and intelligence on Granada's defenses to the crusade; facilitating peaceful garrison disarmament
characters.speech_style: Heavily accented Castilian. Formal, professional soldier's bearing. Speaks with 32 years of hard-won authority.
characters.core_characteristics: Age ~50. Served Granada for 32 years, held five fortresses, fought in 23 battles. Scarred face, graying beard, steady eyes. Witnessed the Battle of Alcala la Real from his walls — the catastrophic destruction of Sultan's 16,000-man army in a single afternoon caused a profound crisis of faith. Chose to convert to Christianity and join the crusade, bringing his son and 70+ garrison members with him. Offers complete intelligence on Granada's defenses.

appearance.distinguishing_features: scarred face; graying beard; steady eyes of a veteran commander

characters.name: Ibrahim ibn Yusuf
characters.title: Former Officer of Alcala la Real Garrison
characters.current_task: Converting to Christianity alongside his father; joining the crusade army; moved by witnessing Christian mercy toward wounded Moors and Juan's personal leadership
characters.speech_style: Halting Castilian. Direct and honest. Speaks with the earnestness of a young man confronting hard truths.
characters.core_characteristics: Age 28. Son of Yusuf ibn Rashid. Admitted killing Christians in battle. Moved to conversion by witnessing Christian surgeons tending wounded Moors, and Juan leading from the front. Conversion driven by observed character rather than coercion.

appearance.distinguishing_features: bears resemblance to his father Yusuf

characters.name: Ahmad al-Zarqali
characters.title: Former Qadi of Alcala la Real / Royal Court Advisor
characters.current_task: Joined Juan II's royal court as advisor and translator; complete religious freedom to search his soul; providing counsel on Muslim customs, Granada's politics and culture; studying Christianity with genuine openness while maintaining Muslim practice
characters.speech_style: Excellent Castilian. Thoughtful, scholarly, precise. Searches for exactly the right words. Honest about uncertainty rather than pretending conviction.
characters.core_characteristics: Age ~40. Qadi (Islamic judge/religious figure) of Alcala la Real for 9 years. Studied in Granada for 12 years. Can recite Quran from memory. Faith profoundly shaken by witnessing the catastrophic destruction of the Sultan's jihad army. Not converting but in deep spiritual crisis. Joined Juan's court to honestly engage with Christianity — 'expert in answers I was taught, not questions I discovered myself.' Values truth over comfortable certainty. Promises honest seeking, not conversion.

appearance.distinguishing_features: intelligent, haunted eyes; fine scholar's robes

characters.name: Martín de Oviedo
characters.title: Guardian Knight
characters.current_task: Recovering from serious wound sustained saving King Juan II during the Battle of Alcala la Real; blade caught him where shoulder met neck in gap in plate armor
characters.speech_style: Simple, direct soldier's speech. Few words, strong actions.
characters.core_characteristics: Guardian knight with 15 years of service and 3 campaigns. Father of two daughters. Saved Juan II's life during the Battle of Alcala la Real by interposing himself between the king and a Moroccan mamluk's blade. Took the strike at the neck/shoulder gap in his armor. Fell wounded but survived.

appearance.distinguishing_features: neck/shoulder wound from Battle of Alcala la Real

characters.name: Álvaro de Estúñiga
characters.title: Commander of the Western Crusade Army
characters.current_task: Commanding western army (12,000 troops + 30 ships) after taking Velez-Malaga; citadel surrendered April 6; military government established; awaiting orders on next objective (Malaga, consolidation, or eastward sweep)
characters.speech_style: Professional military dispatches. Clear, organized reporting.
characters.core_characteristics: Commander of the western crusade army operating from Velez-Malaga. Successfully conducted amphibious landing and took the first major coastal objective. Reports via dispatches to Juan at Jaen. Awaiting further orders.

characters.name: Yahya ibn Malik
characters.title: Granadan Guerrilla Commander
characters.current_task: Leading guerrilla cavalry campaign (~800 riders) against Castilian supply lines; causing real disruption — 180-200 Castilians killed, supply convoys ambushed, messengers killed, Illora siege delayed 2-3 weeks
characters.speech_style: Sharp, bitter, practical. Speaks with the urgency of a man fighting a losing war with whatever means remain.
characters.core_characteristics: Grizzled Granadan cavalry commander who barely escaped the Battle of Alcala la Real. While the Sultan's court was paralyzed by infighting, Yahya organized ~800 surviving light cavalry into guerrilla raiding parties of 10-50 riders. His campaign causes genuine disruption: supply lines hit, messengers killed, siege delayed. The smart play for an outnumbered defender.

appearance.distinguishing_features: grizzled veteran; barely escaped Alcala

characters.name: Don García López de Padilla
characters.title: Senior Calatrava Knight
characters.current_task: Senior Calatrava knight serving in the eastern army; commanded the column section saved from ambush by Juan; participates in war councils and battle planning at Granada
characters.speech_style: Professional military speech. Tactical and respectful.
characters.core_characteristics: Senior Calatrava knight. Commands column section that Juan's personal escort saved from Moorish ambush. Provides tactical advice on positioning and gate bottleneck at Granada.

characters.name: Don Rodrigo de Perea
characters.title: Reconnaissance Coordinator, Eastern Army
characters.current_task: Reconnaissance coordinator for the eastern army; presented intelligence briefing at war council; personally led the night deployment of 1,000 flanking infantry at Granada without detection
characters.speech_style: Precise and factual. Presents intelligence clearly with qualifications on confidence levels.
characters.core_characteristics: Reconnaissance coordinator for the eastern army. Presents intelligence briefings. Personally led the critical night deployment of 1,000 infantry into concealed positions near Granada's gates — succeeded without detection.

characters.name: Don Fadrique Enríquez de Mendoza
characters.title: Admiral of Castile / Cavalry Commander
characters.current_task: Commands the cavalry response (2,500 light + 1,500 heavy) for the planned battle at Granada's gates; told Juan directly 'Trust me to win the battle'; fought at Antequera under Juan's father
characters.speech_style: Confident, direct, authoritative. Speaks with the weight of decades of command experience.
characters.core_characteristics: Age ~45. Admiral of Castile. Scarred veteran who fought at Antequera under Juan I. Commands all cavalry forces at Granada (2,500 light + 1,500 heavy). His job is to deliver the hammer blow when the Sultan's sortie emerges. 'Trust me to win the battle.'

appearance.distinguishing_features: scarred; veteran bearing; fought at Antequera

characters.name: Qaid Yusuf ibn Musa
characters.title: Former Commander of Loja Fortress
characters.current_task: Departed Loja with 800-man garrison under safe-conduct after ceremonial surrender. Marching north to Granada. Professional soldier who negotiated face-saving terms.
characters.speech_style: Professional, dignified. Speaks directly about military realities. Concerned with his men's honor.
characters.core_characteristics: Experienced garrison commander. Gray-bearded veteran. Negotiated surrender of Loja after rapid breach made defense hopeless. Asked for ceremonial surrender to preserve his men's honor. First major fortress commander to surrender by negotiation rather than assault. His words to Juan: 'You have proven stronger. I ask that you remember your word.'

appearance.distinguishing_features: experienced commander's bearing

characters.name: Qaid Ibrahim al-Najjar
characters.title: Former Commander of Malaga Alcazaba
characters.current_task: Surrendered Alcazaba garrison (600 men) after Malaga breached. Acknowledged Juan's mercy. Lives preserved but possessions forfeit per laws of siege.
characters.speech_style: Dignified, professional. Accepts defeat with grace.
characters.core_characteristics: Professional garrison commander of Malaga's Alcazaba. Surrendered within 30 minutes of breaches being stormed, recognizing hopelessness. Cited Juan's honorable treatment of previous garrisons.

characters.name: Captain Yusuf ibn Hassan
characters.title: Former Commander of Gibralfaro Fortress / Castilian Garrison Soldier
characters.current_task: Surrendered Gibralfaro garrison (298 men) and offered 50-80 professional soldiers for Castilian service. Speaks Castilian from frontier trading. Soldiers being integrated across garrisons with Castilian majority oversight.
characters.speech_style: Speaks Castilian from frontier trading. Direct, professional. Career soldier looking for the next employer.
characters.core_characteristics: Age early 40s. Career military man who commands professional soldiers. Surrendered Gibralfaro and made the unprecedented offer of service — his men are professionals who fight for whoever pays well and treats them fairly. Mediterranean tradition of military service transcending religious lines.

appearance.distinguishing_features: career soldier's bearing; speaks Castilian

characters.name: Qaida Muhammad ibn Rashid
characters.title: Former Commander of Ronda Fortress
characters.current_task: Stayed 6 months to help Castilian transition at Ronda. Professional soldier who negotiated peaceful surrender. Working with Don Rodrigo to establish Castilian governance.
characters.speech_style: Clear accented Castilian. Direct, professional. Speaks as one commander to another.
characters.core_characteristics: Experienced military commander in his late 40s. Hajji (completed pilgrimage to Mecca). Negotiated Ronda's peaceful surrender to Juan — recognized strategic hopelessness and chose to save lives. Agreed to stay 6 months to help transition. Earned Juan's respect through honor and pragmatism.

appearance.distinguishing_features: green turban of hajji, sharp eyes, professional bearing

characters.name: Sheikh Ibrahim al-Hamri
characters.title: Chief Administrator of Ronda
characters.current_task: Serving as administrative bridge between old and new governance. Helping organize property transfers and tax collection.
characters.speech_style: Cautious but clear accented Castilian. Speaks as a survivor who knows how to serve whoever holds power.
characters.core_characteristics: Elderly administrator (~70). Served three governors. His grandfather helped build Ronda's current walls. Offered to help implement transition, ensuring orderly process.

appearance.distinguishing_features: walks with cane, shrewd eyes

characters.name: Moshe ben Yitzhak
characters.title: Leader of Ronda's Jewish Community
characters.current_task: Leading 60 Jewish families under new Castilian rule. Relieved by favorable 5% tax terms.
characters.speech_style: Heavily accented Castilian. Hesitant, careful.
characters.core_characteristics: Elderly Jewish community leader. Represents ~60 families who lived as dhimmi under Islamic law. Grateful for better terms under Castilian rule (5% tax vs previous jizya).

appearance.distinguishing_features: dark robes, yellow badge

characters.name: Fra Giovanni da Fiesole (Fra Angelico)
characters.title: Dominican Friar and Master Painter
characters.current_task: Commissioned to paint Juan and Isabel's royal wedding portrait and a devotional piece for Isabel's chapel. Arrived in Toledo at Pope Eugenius IV's personal request.
characters.speech_style: Gentle Italian-accented Latin/Castilian. Speaks with deep humility and spiritual insight.
characters.core_characteristics: Dominican friar and one of the most famous painters in Christendom. Known for luminous religious paintings that seem to glow with divine light. Deeply devout — paints as prayer. Came to Castile because Pope Eugenius IV personally asked him to support the crusade through art.

appearance.distinguishing_features: Dominican white habit, paint-stained fingers, gentle eyes

characters.name: Princess Catalina of Castile
characters.title: Infanta of Castile
characters.current_task: Newborn princess. Miraculously healthy despite traumatic birth.
characters.core_characteristics: First child of Juan II and Isabel. Born Jan 28, 1432 after severe birth crisis. Perfectly healthy.

characters.name: Gómez de Sotomayor
characters.title: Lord of Sotomayor (excommunicated)
characters.current_task: Barricaded in castle after excommunication. Open defiance.
characters.core_characteristics: Excommunicated noble. Barricaded in castle hoping for support.

characters.name: Count of Niebla
characters.title: Count of Niebla (excommunicated)
characters.current_task: Violent defiance. Preparing for siege.
characters.core_characteristics: Excommunicated noble in violent defiance. Worst of the three rebels.
